Apollo Broker Service.generalInfo:
The Apollo Broker Service is a web service used by applications to run disease transmission models (DTMs).

MIDAS developers will find this web service useful for building applications that run the following currently-connected DTMs: pFRED, Pitt-SEIR model, Pitt-Anthrax model, and the Ebola transmission model. Additional models will be available at a future date.

Apollo Location Service.generalInfo:
The Apollo Location Service is an interface to a database of information about locations in which the identifiers are not only location specific but time specific.

The Apollo Location Service web service allows developers to programmatically query the database.

MIDAS developers will find this web service useful for retrieving GeoJSON data for any locations stored in the Apollo LS database.

EpiCaseMap.generalInfo: EpiCaseMap contains a RESTful API that allows users to upload time-coordinate series data and create visualizations for comparing and contrasting data visually. It facilitates this by providing methods for creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting time-coordinate series, visualizations, and related metadata.

Project Tycho.generalInfo:
The Project Tycho API allows users to query the Project Tycho database for publicly available disease surveillance data.

MIDAS developers can use this web service to download disease surveillance data directly into their applications for processing.

RxNorm API.generalInfo:
The RxNorm API is a web service for accessing the current RxNorm data set.

MIDAS developers will find this web service useful when working with data that is encoded using the RxNorm coding system.

Entrez Programming Utilities (E-utilitie.generalInfo:
Entrez is a search engine for National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI) databases. The Entrez Programming Utilities (E-utilities) allows you to execute searches against these databases via web service.

MIDAS developers will find this web service useful when dealing with coding systems developed by the NCBI  (e.g. NCBI Taxonomy IDs). For example, this web service is used by the Apollo Library to look up entries in the NCBI Taxonomy Database.

MedlinePlus Connect.generalInfo:
MedlinePlus Connect is a web service for looking up codes used in the field of health care, namely ICD-9, ICD-10, SNOMED-CT, RXCUI, NDC and LOINC codes.

MIDAS developers will find this web service useful when working with data that is encoded using any of the coding systems listed above.
